definition: trouble/disturbance/rumpus/flirty/coquettish/abbr. for 離騷|离骚[Li2 Sao1]/literary writings/smell of urine/foul smell/male (animal) (dialect)
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: Among the causes of the riots were price increases for cooking oil and sugar.
sentences.chinese: 造成骚乱的原因之一就是食用油和糖料的价格上涨。

sentences.english: Our mission is to harass the landing of the main japanese expeditionary force .
sentences.chinese: 我们的任务是骚乱日本远征军主力的登陆。

sentences.english: The large-scale riots have been based on the facts of the criminal case.
sentences.chinese: 当局已经根据大规模骚乱的事实进行了刑事立案。

sentences.english: That's not right," the monk said of the riots.
sentences.chinese: 这样不对，”他在对骚乱发表评价时说。

sentences.english: Dug activists even disrupted what was to be a placid, respectful funeral for the fallen Moe.
sentences.chinese: 达格族激进分子甚至在莫的肃穆葬礼上挑起骚乱。

sentences.english: Later, as night fell over the tumultuous capital, gunfire could be heard in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 随后，夜幕降临骚乱的首都，远处传来枪声。

sentences.english: The face of disturbances spread, the deployment of 24-hour police shifts Vian.
sentences.chinese: 面对骚乱蔓延，当局部署全天24小时警察轮班维安。

sentences.english: The riot was quickly slapped down.
sentences.chinese: 骚乱很快就被压下去了。

sentences.english: Violent riots in China forced Japanese retailers and factories to shutter.
sentences.chinese: 中国国内的暴力骚乱迫使日企关闭在华零售店和工厂。

sentences.english: Haiti announces vote tally recheck to stem unrest.
sentences.chinese: 海地宣布复检大选票数以抑制社会骚乱。

sentences.english: They reared up and began to attack the policemen.
sentences.chinese: 他们骚乱起来，开始攻击警察。

sentences.english: There are growing signs of more broadly-based popular unrest.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的迹象表明，民众骚乱呈现扩大化趋势。

sentences.english: The turmoil at the Chambishi mine quickly bled into Zambian politics.
sentences.chinese: 昌比希铜矿的骚乱很快蔓延至赞比亚政界。

sentences.english: I don't see the hustle and bustle like where you were brought up, Harp.
sentences.chinese: 哈普，我看在那里就没你长大的地方那么喧嚣和骚乱。

sentences.english: Nothing is more extraordinary than the first breaking out of a riot.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么比暴动的最初骚乱更奇特的了。

sentences.english: There are other forms of civil disorder — most notably, football hooliganism.
sentences.chinese: 还有其他形式的民众骚乱，最出名的是足球流氓行为。

definition: chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
to settle (a dispute)/to quieten down/to suppress
